page.title: 10FARM HOUSES AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The first farms in{Moss}date from around 1700. The farms in{Fenwick date from the 1800's. The houses in Moss and early houses in Fenwick are made from{bricks}made at the local brickworks. The later houses in Fenwick are made from{local stone. Some farms have been modernised. One farm now has got a long sitting room, a middle size kitchen and a dining room, upstairs it has two bedrooms and a bathroom with tiles on the floor and the walls. They have got a sunken bath. To modernise the house they build a{new stone wall}round the old one and fasten the two together. They remove walls inside the house to make the rooms larger. Most of the farms have open{dutch barns}and buildings, such as{stables}and barns. These are used as store houses today for the machinery of modern farming.
